column4: i'm not sure there's a way. ironically, imagemagick does what you want on windows, but i'm afraid clipboard formats are less standardized on unices.
i'm trying to do it with gimp but doesn't work, maybe i'm dong something wrong
Trying to do something like : gimp -i -b '(gimp-edit-paste)' -b '(gimp-png-save-defaults "Image.png")' -b '(gimp-quit 0)'

i'm not even sure other programs are compatible with whatever gimp uses as its clipboard. so perhaps you should ask some gimp guru in a corresponding channel, perhaps they'll whip up a script which runs in gimp for you.
